questions.text:
Full credit will
be given only to solutions which contain appropriate working.
questions.subject: mathematics

questions.text:
Square-ruled paper is provided for
rough working.
Question 1
Expand and simplify (3x + 2)(x - 5).

Question 2
Solve the equation 2x² - 5x - 3 =
questions.subject: mathematics

questions.text:
Question 3
The gradient of a line is 4 and it passes through the point (2, -3). Find the equation of the line in the
form y = mx + c.

Question 4
A circle has center (3, 2) and radius 4 units. Determine whether the point (6, 5) lies inside, on, or
outside the circle.

Question 5
The volume of a sphere is given by the formula V = (4/3)πr³, where r is the radius. If the volume of a
sphere is 288π cm³, calculate the radius of the sphere.
questions.subject: mathematics

marking_schemes.text:
 Correct application of quadratic formula (1 mark)  Correct substitution of values (1 mark)  Correct
answers: x = 3 or x = -0.5 (1 mark)
Question 3 - Marking Scheme
The gradient of a line is 4 and it passes through the point (2, -3). Find the equation of the line in the
form y = mx + c.
 Correct substitution into y = mx + c (1 mark)  Correct working to find c: -3 = 4(2) + c (1 mark) 
Correct final answer: y = 4x - 11 (1 mark)
Question 4 - Marking Scheme
A circle has center (3, 2) and radius 4 units. Determine whether the point (6, 5) lies inside, on, or
outside the circle.
 Correct formula for distance: d = √[(x■-x■)² + (y■-y■)²] (1 mark)  Correct calculation: d = √[(6-3)²
+ (5-2)²] = √[9 + 9] = √18 = 3√2 (1 mark)  Correct conclusion: Since 3√2 < 4, the point lies inside
the circle (1 mark)
Question 5 - Marking Scheme
The volume of a sphere is given by the formula V = (4/3)πr³, where r is the radius. If the volume of a
sphere is 288π cm³, calculate the radius of the sphere.
 Correct substitution: 288π = (4/3)πr³ (1 mark)  Correct rearrangement: r³ = 288 × 3/4 = 216 (1
mark)  Correct answer: r = 6 cm (1 mark)
